name: Porter.Multi

aliases.name: Request
aliases.comment:
We can either:

  - Perform a single request, which will run the Porter Request and at the end turn the result into an `a`,
  - Perform multiple requests: At the end of this request, run a function on the output that generates the next request. Note that this is set up in such a way that only the type of the final request in the chain matters.
  - Short-circuit; just pass on the value `a` without doing any more requests.

values.name: andThen
values.type: (a -> Porter.Multi.Request req res b) -> Porter.Multi.Request req res a -> Porter.Multi.Request req res b

values.name: andThenResult
values.comment:
andThenResult function similar to `andThen`,
but will short-circuit the request/response chain once an `Err val` is received.

Working with Result-objects is very common, since the specialising of `res -> a` (that you pass to `request`) is usually an operation that might fail (like a Decoder)
values.type: (a -> Porter.Multi.Request req res (Result.Result err b)) -> Porter.Multi.Request req res (Result.Result err a) -> Porter.Multi.Request req res (Result.Result err b)

values.name: fromSimple
values.comment: Turns a simple Porter request into a Porter.Multi request
values.type: Porter.Request req res -> Porter.Multi.Request req res res

values.name: map
values.comment: Turns the request's specialized response type into a different type.
values.type: (a -> b) -> Porter.Multi.Request req res a -> Porter.Multi.Request req res b

values.name: map2
values.comment: Chains two requests, and then combines their two responses into one new `c`.
values.type: (a -> b -> c) -> Porter.Multi.Request req res a -> Porter.Multi.Request req res b -> Porter.Multi.Request req res c

values.name: map3
values.comment: Chains three requests, and then combines their three responses into one new `c`.
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> d) -> Porter.Multi.Request req res a -> Porter.Multi.Request req res b -> Porter.Multi.Request req res c -> Porter.Multi.Request req res d

values.name: request
values.comment:
Creates a new Porter.Multi request, specifying:

  - the request itself in the common `req` type
  - A response handler function tha turns the common `res` type into a specialized `a`.
values.type: req -> (res -> a) -> Porter.Multi.Request req res a

values.name: send
values.comment:
Actually sends a (chain of) request(s).

A final handler needs to be specified that turns the final result into a `msg`.
This `msg` will be called with the final resulting `a` once the final response has returned.
values.type: Porter.Config req res msg -> (a -> msg) -> Porter.Multi.Request req res a -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

name: Porter

aliases.name: Config
aliases.comment:
Porter configuration, containing:

  - ports
  - message encoders/decoders.
  - the message that porter will use for its internal communications

aliases.name: Request
aliases.comment:
Opaque type of a 'request'. Use the `request` function to create one,
chain them using `andThen` and finally send it using `send`.

types.name: Model
types.comment: Porter model, used to keep track of response handlers.

values.name: andThen
values.comment:
Chains two Porter requests together:
Run a second one right away when the first returns using its result in the request.
values.type: (res -> Porter.Request req res) -> Porter.Request req res -> Porter.Request req res

values.name: request
values.comment:
Starts a request that can be sent at a later time using `send`,
and that can be combined using `andThen`.

values.name: send
values.comment: Sends a request earlier started using `request`.
values.type: Porter.Config req res msg -> (res -> msg) -> Porter.Request req res -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: subscriptions
values.type: Porter.Config req res msg -> Platform.Sub.Sub msg

values.name: update
values.comment: Update port model based on local messages. Returns a new port model and a local command that must be mapped to the parent message.
values.type: Porter.Config req res msg -> Porter.Msg req res msg -> Porter.Model req res msg -> ( Porter.Model req res msg, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )
